title: How to Prepare a Model Car for Painting

steps.headline: Add some soap and some water into a bucket that is just a bit bigger than the model you'd like to clean.
Rub a dry washcloth onto all the sides of the model.
steps.description: Remember to dry the model's undercarriage too.

steps.headline: Place the wet model car onto a paper towel and let it air dry.
Replace the wet paper towel every hour for at least an eight hour period.
steps.description: You may need to replace the first paper towel after it absorbs some of the moisture.

steps.headline: Use a cotton swab on areas in the model car that might still be wet.
Use a handheld hair dryer on a low speed or cool setting to "brush away" any remaining moisture.
steps.description: However, be careful to dry your hands before plugging in the hair dryer.

text: Add some soap and some water into a bucket that is just a bit bigger than the model you'd like to clean.  Rub a dry washcloth onto all the sides of the model. Remember to dry the model's undercarriage too. Place the wet model car onto a paper towel and let it air dry.  Replace the wet paper towel every hour for at least an eight hour period. You may need to replace the first paper towel after it absorbs some of the moisture. Use a cotton swab on areas in the model car that might still be wet. Some watery areas might remain. Use a handheld hair dryer on a low speed or cool setting to "brush away" any remaining moisture. However, be careful to dry your hands before plugging in the hair dryer.
